body.p: “Broke open a frozen nest of mud and stubble in a black willow “,” probably a robin’s “,” in which were a snail shell and a skunk-cabbage seed. Were they not left there by a mouse? Or could they have been taken up with the mud? They were somewhat in the mud.”
PE 10, pg. 122 / 4 January-23 April 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:26 / T vol. # XX / PDF # XIV / JVIII
